author: gtrintinalia
content: Is this being targeted for devnet-3? <@412614104222531604>

author: _shemnon
content: Besu and nethermind have impls.  It won't break consensus if a client doesn't have it.

author: gtrintinalia
content: Won't it change the config hash? <@403707149043105803>

author: _shemnon
content: yes, as we are changing the name. An inspection of the response would indicate how close it is. That's why I wanted both a hash and the data that makes up the hash returned, so failure isn't opaque, especially if it's small like a different name, but obvious if it is missing contracts.

author: gtrintinalia
content: happy with the change, wondering more about tests for eth_config, (if any) breaking with not all clients have that for devnet-3
